Dispute_Type: Civil dispute over intellectual property rights
Legal_Issue: Whether the defendant's Skyplume apparatus infringes claims 1 and 2 of the '163 patent
Evidence_Assessment: Expert evidence on technical differences in nozzle bifurcation, diffuser presence, and orientation
Decision_Outcome: No infringement found; patent upheld as valid
Burden_of_Proof: On plaintiff to prove infringement; on defendant to prove invalidity
Credibility_Factor: Expert testimony deemed credible and decisive
Legal_Rule: Infringement occurs when all essential elements of a patent claim are reproduced
Standard_of_Review: Objective assessment of claim construction and technical features
Procedural_Issue: Claim construction and evaluation of validity and infringement
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged unauthorized use of patented invention
Outcome_on_Merits: Plaintiff's claim dismissed; defendant's counterclaim on validity rejected
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Fair hearing conducted with both parties presenting evidence
Key_Evidence_Considered: Technical specifications of Skyplume and '163 patent, expert analysis
Legal_Framework: Patent Act (Canada), principles of novelty, utility, non-obviousness
Applicant_Challenge: Plaintiff challenged defendant's product as infringing
Court_Result: Action dismissed; costs awarded to defendant
Legal_Rule_Source: Canadian case law and statutory provisions
Defendant_Response: Denial of infringement and counterclaim for invalidity and unfair trade practices
Outcome: No remedy granted; patent found valid but not infringed
Remedy_Sought: Cease and desist, compensation for alleged infringement
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Lack of essential elements in defendant's product
Jurisdiction: Federal/Provincial courts with jurisdiction over intellectual property matters
Governing_Rule: Essential elements test for patent infringement
